verses.verse: (Proclamation against Egypt) In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:
(Isa 19.1; Jer 25.19; 44.30; 46.2, 25; Ezek 28.21) Mortal, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt;

(Isa 27.1; 51.9; Jer 44.30; Ezek 28.22; 32.2) speak and say: Thus says the Lord GOD: I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great dragon sprawling in the midst of its channels, saying, “My Nile is my own; I made it for myself.”

(2 Kings 19.28; Isa 37.29; Ezek 38.4) I will put hooks in your jaws and make the fish of your channels stick to your scales. I will draw you up from your channels, with all the fish of your channels sticking to your scales.

(Jer 7.33; 34.20; Ezek 32.4-6; 39.4) I will fling you into the wilderness, you and all the fish of your channels; you shall fall in the open field and not be gathered or picked up. To the animals of the earth and to the birds of the air I have given you as food.
(Isa 36.6) Then all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the LORD, because you (Gk Syr Vg: Heb they) were a staff of reed to the house of Israel;
(Jer 37.5-11; Ezek 17.17) when they grasped you with the hand, you broke and tore all their shoulders, and when they leaned on you, you broke and made all their legs give way. (Syr: Heb stand)
(Ezek 14.17; 32.11-13) Therefore, thus says the Lord GOD: I will bring a sword upon you and will cut off from you human and animal,
and the land of Egypt shall be a desolation and a waste. Then they shall know that I am the LORD. Because you (Gk Syr Vg: Heb he) said, “The Nile is mine, and I made it,”
(Ezek 30.6, 12) therefore, I am against you and against your channels, and I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from Migdol to Syene, as far as the border of Cush.
(Jer 43.11, 12; Ezek 32.13) No human foot shall pass through it, and no animal foot shall pass through it; it shall be uninhabited forty years.

(Ezek 30.7, 26) I will make the land of Egypt a desolation among desolated countries, and her cities shall be a desolation forty years among cities that are laid waste. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them among the countries.
(Isa 19.22, 23; Jer 46.26) Further, thus says the Lord GOD: At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were scattered,
and I will restore the fortunes of Egypt and bring them back to the land of Pathros, the land of their origin, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.
It shall be the most lowly of the kingdoms and never again exalt itself above the nations, and I will make them so small that they will never again rule over the nations.

(vv 6, 9, 21|EZK 29:6921; Isa 30.2, 3; 36.4, 6; Jer 14.10; Hos 8.13) The Egyptians (Heb It) shall never again be the reliance of the house of Israel; they will recall their iniquity when they turned to them for aid. Then they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
(Babylonia Will Plunder Egypt) In the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:

(Jer 27.6; Ezek 26.7, 8; 27.31) Mortal, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon made his army labor hard against Tyre; every head was made bald and every shoulder was rubbed bare, yet neither he nor his army got anything from Tyre to pay for the labor that he had expended against it.

(Jer 43.10-13; Ezek 30.4, 10) Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: I will give the land of Egypt to King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and he shall carry off its wealth and despoil it and plunder it, and it shall be the wages for his army.
(Isa 45.1-3; Jer 25.9) I have given him the land of Egypt as his payment for which he labored, because they worked for me, says the Lord GOD.

(v 6|EZK 29:6; Ps 132.17; Ezek 6.7; 24.27; 33.22; Lk 21.15) On that day I will cause a horn to sprout up for the house of Israel, and I will open your lips among them. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.
